alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Liberty; Polk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:28PM CST until January 26 at 1:41AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Long King Creek near Livingston affecting San Jacinto and Polk Counties. Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Polk and Hardin Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. Spring Creek Near Hegar Road affecting Harris County. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Colorado and Wharton Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menard Creek near Rye. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 20.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 13.1 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 13.2 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 05/15/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Menard Creek Rye 20.0 14.3 Wed 8 pm CST 19.2 16.7 14.1 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 930 AM CST.
